sources.title: PublicdomainTheLastoftheMohicans
sources.description: Adaptation of James Fenimore Cooper novel about the American frontier during the French and Indian War.

sources.title: Last Of The Mohicans
sources.description: First film adaptation from the James Fenimore Cooper novel of the same name. This film also features one of Boris Karloff's earliest film appearances in a small uncredited role as a Native American.

sources.title: The Last of the Mohicans (1920)
sources.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil Magua. Fighting to rescue the women are Chingachgook and his son Uncas, the last of the Mohican tribe, and their white ally, the frontiersman Natty Bumppo, known as Hawkeye. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/the-last-of-the-mohicans-1920/

sources.title: The Last Of The Mohicans (1920)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Still considered by many to be the best adaptation of the novel, the 1920 version of The Last Mohicans isn't without its issues; most noticeably using almost exclusively white actors to portray Native characters. However, this version has been especially praised for its visual storytelling and for a fantastic performance from Barbara Bedford.

sources.title: The Last of the Mohicans (1920) Action, Adventure, Drama Silent Film
sources.description:
As Alice and Cora Munro, the daughters of a British officer are kidnapped during a war between France and England. The last of the Mohican tribe, and  the frontiersman Hawkeye, their white ally, besiege the fort where they are locked up to try to rescue them. 

Directors: Clarence Brown, Maurice Tourneur
Writers: James Fenimore Cooper, Robert Dillon 
Stars: Wallace Beery, Barbara Bedford, Alan Roscoe 
Genre:  Classics, Drama, Romance, Silent, Action, Adventure

Fighting to rescue the women are Chingachgook and his son Uncas, the last of the Mohican tribe, and their white ally, the frontiersman Natty Bumppo, known as Hawkeye.
